comments.body: I think we should set value for `after_change_ntp_servers` in results dictionary, otherwise in check mode we will receive blank and will raise KeyError for playbook.

It just doesn't display ```after_change_ntp_servers``` in check mode. There are no errors raised. However, I just found out that the NTP servers will be added and an existing dummy entry isn't deleted. I will add ```after_change_ntp_servers``` and change the code to overwrite existing NTP servers.

Ok, I added:
```
if self.module.check_mode:
    self.results[host.name]['after_change_ntp_servers'] = available_ntp_servers
```
Now the NTP server configuration after the change will be displayed.

Anyway. Discuss that internally. I'm tired of it...

My advice was given when reviewing a new module. But I still stand by it.

Examples should be self-explanatory, and for that reason using real values is more meaningful than using `'{{ cluster }}'`. Using a Jinja variable as value does not give a clue to what the value really is, nor is it clear to the end-user where to define this (if he happens to know this is a variable). If it contains `cluster01` the user knows he needs to adapt it to his cluster name.

We simply cannot expect the reader to be an Ansible expert. Same for the credentials, which we hope to move to the connection-layer at some point in the future.

If this rationale is disputable, let's move this to the Documentation WG, but I hope it is self-evident that examples work better with real values.

cc @acozine

@ckotte I apologise that your PR has got caught up in discussions regarding how to improve the docs. For the moment please revert these changes and we can do a bulk tidy up once the new format has been decided, perhaps as part of https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/43433

We generally try and have these discussions outside of general PRs to avoid this exact back and forth.

For the record, I think examples using `example.com` and using documentation IP ranges are good. Though consistency in what we have is also important.

Once agreed this will end up on https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/dev_guide/developing_modules_documenting.html#module-documenting
